info.description:
# prompt-toolkit-menu
Very simple menu system for prompt-toolkit-menu

## Usage
Create a menu with or without a title:

```
from prompt_toolkit_menu import Menu

m = Menu('Welcome')
```

Then add items:

```
from prompt_toolkit.widgets import Checkbox, TextArea
username = TextArea(multiline=False, prompt='Username: ')
password = TextArea(multiline=False, password=True, prompt='Password: ')
m.add_item(username)
m.add_item(password)
remember = Checkbox(text='Remember Credentials')
remember.checked = False
m.add_item(remember)

# Add buttons with a decorator:
@m.add_button()
def connect():
    """Create a sub menu of possible hosts."""
    m2 = Menu('Connect')
    for host in ('microsoft.com', 'github.com', 'google.com'):
        m2.add_button(
            host
        )(lambda h=host: print('Connecting to %s...' % h))

    # Add a way back to the previous menu.
    @m2.add_button('Back')
    def go_back():
        """Return to the previous menu."""
        # Show the first menu.
        m.set_layout()

    # Override the current app layout with the layout from the new menu.
    m2.set_layout()

# Add a separator. Pass an argument to change the text.
m.add_separator()

# One last button.
@m.add_button('Exit')
def do_exit():
    """Exit the app."""
    app.exit()
```
